alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 7:51PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Chippewa, Yellow Medicine and Lac qui Parle Counties. .Thunderstorms caused 2 to 4 inches of rain across portions of southern Minnesota Wednesday night. Some localized areas even received amounts greater than 4 inches. Rivers within this region have risen sharply with 2 rising above flood stage. Additional rainfall into this weekend should mean a slow decline in most river levels after cresting. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Low lying areas and some roads along the river begin flooding, along with some basements of houses along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 700 PM CDT Thursday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.9 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet on 10/11/2017. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
